channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: One U.S. diplomat describes being laid off amid sweeping cuts
item.description: After 14 years as a U.S. diplomat, one officer talks about being laid off in the State Department's sweeping cuts, losing both career and professional identity.
item.content:encoded: After 14 years as a U.S. diplomat, one officer talks about being laid off in the State Department's sweeping cuts, losing both career and professional identity.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: 19 photos were released from the Epstein files. We unpack their significance
item.description: Nineteen of 95,000 photos for the Jeffrey Epstein files were released by a House committee Friday. What do they tell us and when will more information be available?
item.content:encoded: Nineteen of 95,000 photos for the Jeffrey Epstein files were released by a House committee Friday. What do they tell us and when will more information be available?
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: The Justice Department has now sued 18 states in an effort to access voter data
item.description: The Department of Justice has sued four more states as part of the Trump administration's far-reaching attempt to access sensitive voter data. The DOJ is also suing Fulton County in Georgia.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Justice has sued four more states as part of the Trump administration's far-reaching attempt to access sensitive voter data. The DOJ is also suing Fulton County in Georgia.

(Image credit: Jason Connolly)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: In photos: Flooding in Western Washington state forces thousands to evacuate
item.description: Record flooding in Washington state has forced tens of thousands of people to evacuate after torrential rains this week.
item.content:encoded:
Record flooding in Washington state has forced tens of thousands of people to evacuate after torrential rains this week.

(Image credit: Megan Farmer)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Trial starts for a Wisconsin judge accused of obstructing ICE
item.description: Was Judge Hannah Dugan trying to obstruct a proceeding or trying to run her courtroom when ICE agents came to arrest an undocumented immigrant? A federal jury will decide
item.content:encoded:
Was Judge Hannah Dugan trying to obstruct a proceeding or trying to run her courtroom when ICE agents came to arrest an undocumented immigrant? A federal jury will decide

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from ICE custody. And, Indiana rejects redistricting
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man the Trump administration mistakenly deported in March and eventually returned, is now free from ICE custody. And, Indiana lawmakers reject a redistricting proposal.
item.content:encoded:
Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man the Trump administration mistakenly deported in March and eventually returned, is now free from ICE custody. And, Indiana lawmakers reject a redistricting proposal.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: For 50 years, Rockalina the turtle lived on a kitchen floor. Now she has a new friend
item.description: The Oreo-sized baby turtle represents a turning point in Rockalina's recovery: Spending time with her own kind.
item.content:encoded:
The Oreo-sized baby turtle represents a turning point in Rockalina's recovery: Spending time with her own kind.

(Image credit: Garden State Tortoise)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: U.S. military members fear personal legal blowback tied to boat strikes
item.description: Staff officers and at least one drone pilot have sought advice from outside groups over legal concerns about their own involvement — or potential involvement — in the strikes against suspected drug boats.
item.content:encoded:
Staff officers and at least one drone pilot have sought advice from outside groups over legal concerns about their own involvement — or potential involvement — in the strikes against suspected drug boats.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A look at the current state of the war in Ukraine, the Salvadoran national who became a symbol of Trump's deportation efforts released from ICE custody, Indiana lawmakers reject redistricting plan.
item.content:encoded: A look at the current state of the war in Ukraine, the Salvadoran national who became a symbol of Trump's deportation efforts released from ICE custody, Indiana lawmakers reject redistricting plan.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Why the U.S. struggles with passenger service despite having the most rail lines
item.description: The U.S. has the most railroad tracks of any country, but we're not known for our passenger trains. A look at America's rail system and the trouble with passenger trains.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. has the most railroad tracks of any country, but we're not known for our passenger trains. A look at America's rail system and the trouble with passenger trains.
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha
